Chloe Chotrani

Chloe Calderon Chotrani (b. 1992, Singaporean) Embodiment Facilitator. Somatic Practitioner.
Movement Artist.

Chloe spent her youth deep in the study of world dance and movement forms; from underground dance movements of Metro Manila to traditional forms in West Africa, to the downtown dance scene in New York, and her travels around Southeast Asia.

Her movement journey has brought her to integrate the inter-dependent fields of the healing arts, embodiment practices, psycho- somatic therapy, trauma sensitivity, communal care, and gardening.

Chloe seeks to increase safety for clients to be present with their body, explore their inner landscapes and find expression and resolution; to live a more connected life.

Having come into somatic therapy from a movement and dance background, she grew up being used to sensing bodies. Her strong kinaesthetic sensibility allows her to attune to the unspoken story of the body and support clients to connect safely to the felt sense.
